justification: The article states that μ has been "previously discussed in the literature as a parameter representing nonanalytic processes," and Balota & Spieler (1988) explicitly link μ to "stimulus-driven automatic (nonanalytic) processes."
Balota & Spieler (1988) are quoted saying that τ represents "more central attention demanding (analytic) processes," tying the analytic construct to the τ parameter.
Penner-Wilger, Leth-Steensen, & LeFevre (2002) "interpreted μ as an index of memory retrieval," directly linking the construct of memory retrieval to μ.
The same passage notes that τ was viewed as an index of "nonretrieval (i.e., use of procedures)," identifying τ as the measure of procedural calculation processes.

measured_by: response time in a numerical comparison task
justification: The classic finding of Moyer & Landauer (1967) is described as "the numerical distance effect, where the response time increases as the numerical distance ... decreases," showing that the effect is assessed via response times.

measured_by: response time in a two-digit number comparison task
justification: Nuerk et al. (2001) found that "response times were faster" for compatible than incompatible trials, indicating that RTs in the comparison task operationalize the unit-decade compatibility effect.
